The photo in question shows a warning la: This product is an ear loop mask, this product is not a respirator and will not provide any protections against COVID-19 (coronavirus) and other viruses or contaminants." This label is being misinterpreted as evidence that masks are not effective, but it is a misunderstanding of the kind of protection standard masks provide.
The expert emphasizes that certain medic: grade masks, such as the N95 respirator, offer the most protection against viral particles for the wearer. However, other masks like the ones in the photo or homemade fabric masks are effective in reducing the spread of the disease by helping to stop asymptomatic individuals from unknowingly spreading the virus.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prev: CDC) does not recommend that the general public wear medical-grade masks like the N95, as they are in high demand and should be reserved for healthcare workers in direct contact with infected patients. This recommendation further supports the effectiveness of other types of masks in reducing the spread of COVID-19.
The claim being fact: checked is an online rumor that different face masks are ineffective in protecting against the spread of COVID-19. The expert's verdict refutes this claim and provides evidence to support the effectiveness of various masks in reducing the spread of the disease.
